edu.umd.umiacs.cummings.GSBL
Class GSBLJob

java.lang.Object
  edu.umd.umiacs.cummings.GSBL.GSBLJob

public class GSBLJob
extends java.lang.Object

Base class from which different types of Grid jobs can extend.

Constructor Detail

GSBLJob

public GSBLJob(java.lang.String executable,
               java.lang.String arguments,
               java.lang.String scheduler,
               java.lang.String resource,
               java.lang.String arch_os,
               java.lang.String workingDir,
               int runtime_estimate,
               java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> shared_files,
               java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String[]> perjob_files,
               java.lang.String[] output_files,
               java.lang.String requirements,
               java.lang.String extraRSL)
        throws java.lang.Exception
Class constructor. Initializes all fields EXCEPT myJob, which is left to the subclasses.

Parameters:
executable - the full path to the program executable.
arguments - the arguments to the executable.
scheduler - the ManagedJobFactoryService this job is being assigned to
resource - one of BOINC, Condor, etc
arch_os - if resource == "Condor", this variable determines architecture and operating system job is being assigned to
workingDir - used to determine the location of our staging directory.
runtime_estimate - used in scheduling
shared_files -
perjob_files -
output_files - an array of relative filnames to stage back to the server. They will be staged to the job's working directory.
requirements - used by Condor and our old matchmaking system. Could be used again in the future.
extraRSL - some jobs have special requirements, like reading stdin, for example
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

GSBLJob

public GSBLJob(java.lang.String rwd)
Constructor used to instantiate an existing job.

Parameters:
jobEPR - endpoint reference of a Globus GramJob
rwd - remote working directory, i.e., staging directory on the server

getFilename

public java.lang.String getFilename(java.lang.String filename)
Map relative to absolute filenames. Given a relative filename such as "foo", returns the absolute filename corresponding to foo, e.g. "/export/grid_files/18485851/foo".

Parameters:
filename - the relative filename to map.
Returns:
an absolute filename as a String.
